SENT.plain: Fukuyama-type congenital muscular dystrophy (FCMD) is a severe autosomal-recessive muscular dystrophy accompanied by brain malformation
Previously, we identified the gene responsible for FCMD through positional cloning
Here we report the isolation of its murine ortholog, Fcmd
The predicted amino acid sequence of murine fukutin protein encoded by Fcmd is 90% identical to that of its human counterpart
Radiation hybrid mapping localized the gene to 2.02 cR telomeric to D4Mit272 on chromosome 4
Northern blot analysis revealed ubiquitous expression of Fcmd in adult mouse tissues
Through in situ hybridization, we observed a wide distribution of Fcmd expression throughout embryonic development, most predominantly in the central and peripheral nervous systems
We also detected high Fcmd expression in the ventricular zone of proliferating neurons at 13.5 days post-coitum
Brain malformation in FCMD patients is thought to result from defective neuronal migration
Our data suggest that neuronally expressed Fcmd is likely to be important in the development of normal brain structure
